channel.title: F2PDEV release
channel.description:
[u][i]This is [i]all[/i] made off a blank Project Insanity, did it myself. It's not much of nothing, just a F2P server. (Free-to-Play Development) So, let's get started..[/i][/u]
[b]Features:[/b] - Two F2P Shops (Armor Shop/F2P Pk'ing Supplies) - Made all ways outside the F2P areas blocked off (It'll send a message saying you must be a donor to use this feature.) - Removed ALL deadcode from the regular PI. - Removed most minigames (Pest Control, FightCaves, Barrows) - go download the regular PI and integrate it. It's not hard, at all. - More. Just check the "Updates" thread in the source. Download it check it out. Or check the Development thread.
This is a guess to say SHARD of what I'm fully developing. Only one little piece of what I'm developing (; Probably won't release the full version (With donor abilities/quests)
[b]Love it or hate it, I couldn't give a fuck. It's a basic F2P server, I guess to be developed upon. A majority of the community wanted one, so be it![/b]
Download: http://up.ht/pX4vx1 Client: [Download Graham's or use a ordinary PI client.. Not releasing this one, cbf.] & with a little bit of Google, found this 474 client: http://www.filesonic.com/file/42452457
If you see the Dev thread, read this. I'm putting this off as a side siiide project. As in it won't be worked on much, but when it does, it'll be for long periods of time. Switching on and off, going to try out 600+. (:
[b]Credits:[/b] Dagenham Killamess Naffer ^ You can figure the percentages out yourself, just got it off the Bare-Bones source I used (PI.) ApocalypseX (0.001%) - adding the 1-2 hours worth of slacking out F2P features (;

item.title: F2PDEV release
item.dc:creator: @ApocalypseX ApocalypseX
item.description:
@ApocalypseX wrote:

[quote=“vManlyMan, post:10, topic:406219”][quote author=ApocalypseX link=topic=503216.msg3681800#msg3681800 date=1311577398]

NP, but I can’t get any clients working with it. >:(

Merr. Give me a few?
I’ll upload this one. Sheesh it’ll take a while.
On slow internet, and the cache is in the client folder which makes it even bigger. xD

Ok, thanks.

Hmm. I tried the client I put too, that one is funky as hell.
The one that I originally use is Sagi’s. Found here:
http://www.filesonic.com/file/42452457
Sorry, that’ll be last download xD
[/quote]

Mmk. I’m downloding it now.[/quote]
Alright ;D tell me if it works.

Read full topic

item.title: F2PDEV release
item.dc:creator: @ApocalypseX ApocalypseX
item.description:
@ApocalypseX wrote:

This is all made off a blank Project Insanity, did it myself.
It’s not much of nothing, just a F2P server. (Free-to-Play Development)
So, let’s get started…

Features:

  • Two F2P Shops (Armor Shop/F2P Pk’ing Supplies)
  • Made all ways outside the F2P areas blocked off (It’ll send a message saying you must be a donor to use this feature.)
  • Removed ALL deadcode from the regular PI.
  • Removed most minigames (Pest Control, FightCaves, Barrows) - go download the regular PI and integrate it. It’s not hard, at all.
  • More. Just check the “Updates” thread in the source. Download it check it out. Or check the Development thread.

This is a guess to say SHARD of what I’m fully developing. Only one little piece of what I’m developing (; Probably won’t release the full version (With donor abilities/quests)

Love it or hate it, I couldn’t give a fuck. It’s a basic F2P server, I guess to be developed upon. A majority of the community wanted one, so be it!

Download: http://up.ht/pX4vx1
Client: [Download Graham’s or use a ordinary PI client… Not releasing this one, cbf.]
& with a little bit of Google, found this 474 client: http://www.filesonic.com/file/42452457

If you see the Dev thread, read this.
I’m putting this off as a side siiide project. As in it won’t be worked on much, but when it does, it’ll be for long periods of time. Switching on and off, going to try out 600+. (:

Credits:
Dagenham
Killamess
Naffer
^ You can figure the percentages out yourself, just got it off the Bare-Bones source I used (PI.)
ApocalypseX (0.001%) - adding the 1-2 hours worth of slacking out F2P features (;

Read full topic
